summary: Implements a single-screen Valentine prompt with an evasive ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button and a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù result view showing ‚ÄúGood choice‚Äù and referencing the required meme asset, but deviates from exact button labels/English-only text, adds non-requested Internet Identity/backend scaffolding, and the static image file itself is not evidenced in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: On initial load, show the question "Will you be my Valentine?" with exactly two buttons labeled "Yes" and "No" (no additional primary actions).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows the buttons labeled with extra punctuation/emojis ("Yes! üíñ" and "No üò¢"), and additional user-facing prompt text ("Choose wisely... üíï"), so it does not match the exact label requirement.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the generated meme image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend.
missing_requirements.reason: The app references the asset path, but the diff summary does not show the actual image file added under frontend/public/assets/generated.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend canister file added/changed despite requirement that no backend canister changes are required.
hallucinated_features.reason: A new backend file is added even though the BuildRequest states no backend changes are needed.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication scaffolding added (hooks/provider and actor logic).
hallucinated_features.reason: Internet Identity authentication is explicitly listed as a non-goal, but the diff adds an InternetIdentityProvider and related hooks plus an actor hook tied to identity.
Not requested by the BuildRequest; may be considered an extra action beyond the Valentine prompt interactions.
